meaning: inter-, mutual, together, each other, minister of state, councillor, aspect, phase, physiognomy

onyomiExamples.meaning: appearance, look, countenance, a 'seeming' that fortune-tellers relate to one's fortune, aspect, phase (e.g. solid, liquid and gaseous)
reality, real state of affairs, true state of affairs, true form of all things as they are, ultimate reality
social conditions, phase of life, (sign of) the times, state of society
partaking, participating, taking part in, sharing (something with someone)
